document.docTitle: Brasilidia auleta Szeptycki & Bedano, 2003, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Brasilidia auleta sp. n., a new species from Argentina (Protura: Acerentomidae s. l.)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Brasilidia auleta sp. n., a new species from Argentina (Protura: Acerentomidae s. l.)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Foretarsal sensilla b and c short, nearly equal. Six anterior setae on urotergite VI (
A 4
is absent), 16 “P” seta on VII (
P 3 a
absent) and 10 setae on X (seta
1 a
absent). No traces of striation on the “striate band” of abdominal segment VIII, but some oblique lines present.

Head with very short rostrum, head setae short. Additional and postpseudocular seta present. Seta situated anteriorly to pseudoculus (in most of Acerentomidae s.l.) absent. Dorsal side with 3 + 3 modified setae in shape of thin, hair­like microchaetae, setae on ventral side not differentiated. Pseudoculus mostly elongated (sometimes nearly round) with long lever, PR 11–14 . Canal of maxillary gland long, with round, flat calyx, and distinctly bilobed posterior dilation, CF 5–6 . Sensilla of maxillary palps thin, nearly seta­like, equal. Labial palps with no tuft, with 2 long and 1 short seta, and with short, elongated sensillum. Mandible relatively broad, with no apical teeth.

Main setae on nota short, slightly differentiated, mesonotal seta
P 2
1.4–1.5 x length of seta
P 1
.
P 1 a
,
P 2 a
as short, hair­like microchaetae;
P 2 a
on meso­ and metanotum nearer to
P 3
than to
P 2
;
P 4 a
on metanotum not differentiated (longer than
P 4
),
P 5
as small sensillum. Seta
A 2
on thoracic sterna,
M 2
on prosternum as small, hair­like microchaetae. Pronotum with no pores, mesonotum with pore al and l , metanotum with pore l . Thoracic sterna with no pores.

Foretarsus with short sensillum a , slightly passing base of d ; b short, not reaching level of
3
; c short, slightly longer than b ; d situated much nearer to c than to e , of medium length, passing level of e ; e relatively short, not reaching tip of f ; f not reaching base of claw, longer than e ; g short and thin, not reaching base of claw. All sensilla of external side thin, parallel­sided. Proximal pore proximally to base of
3
. Sensillum
t 1
with distinct head (nearly “baculiform”);
t 2
filiform, short and thin;
t 3
relatively long, cylindrical. Sensillum a' distally to level of
t 1
, short, thicker than other sensilla, parallel­sided; b' and c' equal, relatively long, thin. Setae
1
and
4
not modified, of same shape as setae
1 – 3
and
5
. Seta
4
proximally to base of c' , subequal to
1
. Length formula of foretarsal sensilla:
t 3
<
t 1
< a’ < b = g < c =
t 2
< e = b’ = c’ < a = d < f . BS about 0.6 , TR 3.3–3.6 , EU about 0.1 .

Abdominal chaetotaxy of general
Acerentulus
­ type (Table I), seta
P 3
on urotergite II– VI in anterior position. Urotergite I without
P 1 a
;
P 2 a
and
A 5
of same shape as
P 1 a
on nota. Urotergite II–VI without setae
P 1 a
and
P 3 a
; accessory setae as that on nota; on urotergite
VI 3
+ 3 anterior setae (
A 4
absent). Urotergite VII with 3 + 3 anterior setae (
A 1
,
A 4
,
A 5
), seta
P 1 a
and
P 2 a
present, P 3 a absent. All accessory setae as that on preceding tergites. Seta
P 4 a
as other ones, situated on membrane between tergite and laterotergite. Pore al dorsally to
A 5
on urotergite II–VI, on VII ventrally to it. Pore psm on urotergites I–VI in anterior (“normal”) position, on VII very near to hind margin of tergite, close to seta
P 1 a
. Pore psl , membranal and laterotergal pores absent. Anterior lines on urotergite VII invisible.

Abdominal legs with 4, 3, 3 setae. Accessory setae on urosternite I–VI as that on tergites (slightly longer), on VII as that on preceding sternites. Urosternite VII without seta Pc . Urosternite I–V with no pores, VI with 1 + 1 pore, situated very close to seta
P 1 a
; VII with single asymmetrical pore situated close to
P 1 a
.

Striate band reduced, with no traces of “hook­like design”, on tergite with some distinct, oblique lines, on sternite smooth. Urotergite and urosternite VIII smooth (sometime with traces of indistinct row of very small granules in median part). Comb VIII with right hind margin, composed of 7–10 small, irregular teeth.

Seta
1 a
on urotergite IX subequal to seta
1
, on X absent. Urotergite XI with 3 + 3 setae, seta
1
long. Dorsal lobe of telson with long hind margin setae and single dorsal pore. Urosternite XI with 2 + 2 setae, external ones shorter than internal.
Female squama genitalis with conical acrostyli situated nearly apical. Males unknown.

Maturus junior with no seta
1 a
on urosternite VIII and with no setae on urosternite XI. Larva II with larval seta on urosternite XII.

Chaetal variability. Imagines (
7 specimens
) ­ asymmetrical lack of seta
1 a
on urosternite VIII ( 2 sp­s). Maturi juniores ( 2 sp­ns) – asymmetrical presence of seta A 2 on urotergites VII ( 1 sp­n). Larvae II ( 2 sp­ns) ­ lack of Ac on urosternite III ( 1 sp­n).

Measurements (in m) Holotype : Female nr 6274 from Cuesta Blanca, Córdoba province, ( Argentine ) at 800 masl., undisturbed, uncultivated soil covered with typical Espinal natural vegetation.
21 ­ 05­ 2001
. Leg. José C. Bedano.

Paratypes : together with holotype ,
6 females
.

Not included into the type material: 2 maturi juniores,
2 larvae
II and 1 larva I (together with holotype ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 10–17.
Brasilidia auleta
sp. n. 10 – nota (paratype nr 6275); 11 – anterolateral part of mesonotum (holotype); 12 – anterolateral part of metanotum (magnif. as 11) (holotype); 13 ­ foretarsus, exterior view (holotype); 14 ­ foretarsus, interior view (magnif. as 13) (holotype); 15 ­ abdominal leg I (holotype); 16 ­ abdominal leg III (magnif. as 15) (holotype); 17 – female squama genitalis (magnif. as 15) (paratype nr 6280). Scale: 20 m.

FIGURES 18–25.
Brasilidia auleta
sp. n. 18 – urotergite VI and VII (magnif. as 20) (paratype nr 6278); 19 ­ seta P4a on urotergite VII (holotype); 20 ­ urosternite VI and VII (paratype nr 6278); 21 – urotergite VIII – XI & telson (paratype nr 6275); 22 – urosternite VIII – XI & telson (magnif. as 21) (paratype nr 6275); 23 – “striate band”, dorsal part (paratype nr 6275); 24 – “striate band”, ventral part (paratype nr 6275); 25 ­ comb VIII (magnif. as 19) (holotype). Scale: 20 m.

subSubSection.paragraph: The holotype , paratypes nr 6275 ­ 77 and young specimens are preserved in the Institute of Systematics and Evolution of Animals P.A.S. (Kraków, Poland ); the paratypes 6278 ­ 80 in La Plata museum (La Plata, Argentina ).
Derivatio nominis: Named after Auletas, the ancient tribe of Indians which were formerly living in the type area.
